text: no summer party is complete without
something refreshing and delightful to
drink so today I'm gonna provide you
with a really fun drink it's a tropical
fruit sangria I'm gonna use a
combination of mango pineapple and
cantaloupe and then you flavor it with a
combination of mint and basil and fresh
ginger amazingly refreshing and
make-ahead so great for parties peel
your mangos try to use the ripe Astrid's
that you can find so if there are no
ripe mangoes just replace it with
something else you're gonna need a total
of 6 cups of fruit whatever you choose
to use peaches would be really good in
here with the ginger I love peaches and
ginger so you could try something like
that if you wanted to cut the fruit into
chunks I'm just cutting the fruit of the
mango away from the pit so that I can
cut it into larger chunks all the fruits
and chunks about 1 and 1/2 inches you
could do slices but jokes are great
because they do fit into a glass and
they're easier to eat out of a glass
than big long slices for a sec peel some
ginger use the edge of a thin spoon the
thicker spoons just don't seem to work
but the thin spoons work really well for
just working around the ginger and
peeling off just the skin and nothing
else you'll need 1/4 cup of thinly
sliced ginger cut into little disks and
then if you want to like I want to I'm
gonna smash the ginger just a little bit
with the back of my knife to release a
little bit more flavor and of course
letting it sit for a while also helps oh
you can make this and drink it right
away but if you let it sit for a few
hours or even overnight the flavors
really build now you just combine
everything I'm gonna do it sort of like
a punch so combine all your fruits
pineapple cantaloupe you can see where
I'm going with the colors getting here
right so pretty I'm not gonna use all
the mango looked like I had more than
two cups there looks good ok add your
ginger 3 tablespoons of lemon juice
lime juice would be nice to have limes
go ahead and use that delicious and then
one and a half cups of herbs you can use
basil you can use mint you can use a
combination a mint and make sure you
save some fresh herbs to garnish your
glasses because that's festive and
smells really good
half a cup of Cointreau or any other
orange flavored liqueur this is a white
sangria so I'm using white wine and
Cointreau a lot of sangria choose brandy
this is a summary version and then a
bottle of white wine if you're making it
ahead you just leave it at this stir it
around put it into the refrigerator and
the flavors will build and meld and
become amazing but if you're gonna serve
it right away you can add your ice and
that's it it's done I like to match it
up a little bit because I think it
releases all the flavors let it sit for
a while I recommend making this at least
an hour ahead so that it really has time
to develop its flavor but I am NOT
patient so I'm gonna have a little bit
right now I'll let the rest of it sit
make sure you get some of each kind of

really refreshing you guys are gonna
